content: marble fidget bracelet designed by shana s cohen i am always in search of creative fidget toys for my son and love incorporating my craft into these projects i stumbled upon a post on social media showing a small knit bracelet tube with a marble and have since been making them for my son and other family and friends a few knitters requested i write directions for how i make the bracelets so here they are these simple bracelets are suitable for children and adults directions are included for both fingering and dk weight yarns enjoy test knitting norah b stacie b wendy n-h amanda u materials yarn tools each bracelet uses approximately 4-6 g of fingering or fingering weight us 1 2 25 mm circular needle 32 80 dk weight yarn this is a great project to use up yarn cm or longer for magic loop or double-pointed needles or scraps leftover from another project size needed to get gauge dk weight us 3 3 25 mm circular needle 32 80 cm or fingering weight gauge longer for magic loop or double-pointed needles or size 8 stitches = 1 2 5 cm in stockinette in the round needed to get gauge crochet hook of similar size for provisional cast-on dk weight gauge spare needle in same size or smaller 7 stitches = 1 2 5 cm in stockinette in the round scissors smooth waste yarn size tapestry needle customizable- samples shown are approximately 1 2 5 1 standard glass marble for each bracelet 1/2 13 mm cm measured across and 1 2 5 cm longer than wrist diameter some testers used decorative glass craft beads or flat-bottomed glass drops in lieu of standard marbles can t measure your recipient s wrist suggested lengths 4-5 year old 6 15 cm abbreviations used 6-10 year old 7 17 5 cm k knit preteen to small adult 7 5 19 cm adult 8 20 cm special techniques find videos for provisional cast on and grafting here https //www shanalines com/tutorials/ directions using smooth waste yarn and a crochet hook provisionally cast on 14 stitches for dk weight yarn or 16 stitches for fingering weight yarn onto preferred needle for small diameter knitting using preferred working color knit 1 row flat then join in the round k every round until work measures 1 2 5 cm longer than wrist insert 1 marble into the tube created before cutting the working yarn try on the bracelet to make sure it will fit with the marble inside when you are satisfied with the fit cut working yarn leaving a tail at least 12 30 cm long carefully remove waste yarn from provisional cast on placing live stitches on spare needle of same working size or smaller see photos on p 2 thread tail yarn onto tapestry needle graft live stitches to provisionally cast-on stitches to close the tube forming your finished bracelet with the marble inside when all stitches have been joined tuck tail yarn
